description.narrative: U.S. Department of Commerce, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA): Improving the capacity of Belize's Marine Protected Areas co-managers to address capacity needs identified by Gulf and Caribbean Fisheries Institute (GCFI) - MPA Connect network. The project seeks to build capacity to address the management needs identified in the MPA Connect capacity needs assessment of 2017 for relevant Marine Protected Areas (MPA) sites in Belize. In realizing this objective, the project will include capacity-building for socioeconomic assessment and monitoring, strengthening of enforcement programs, and improving governance among marine protected areas co-managers. The socioeconomic assessment will also include an assessment of the implementation of Managed Access; a fisheries management program in Belize that requires an external evaluation engaging all stakeholders including fishers, fishing groups, NGOs, relevant private investors, and government departments and ministries. At least one knowledge product will be generated for sharing with the wider Caribbean MPA network to assist in building capacities regionally.
